reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Improving the resilience of the health system in Mali

description.narrative: Mali - RSSH - Ministère de la Santé et du Développement Social de la République du Mali - MOH. This program has the following goals: SRPS : Contribuer à l'amélioration de l'état de santé et du bien-être de la population malienne / RSSH: Contribute to improving the health and well-being of the Malian population. The objectives of this program are: SRPS : Le système d’approvisionnement est régulièrement renforcé pour assurer la mise a disposition des produits de santé / RSSH: The supply system is regularly strengthened to ensure the availability of health products. SRPS : Le système d’approvisionnement est régulièrement renforcé pour la mise en place d'un réseau national de laboratoires performants / RSSH: The Supply system is regularly strengthened for the implementation of a naitonal network of efficient laboratories. SRPS : Les services délivrés par le système de santé (Public, Privé et communautaire) sont résilients et pérennes pour améliorer la santé de la population/ RSSH: the services provided by the health system (public, private and community) are resilient and sustainable to improve the health of the population

title.narrative: Impact indicator for MLI-S-MOH
HSS I-Other 3 Number of new HIV infections per 1000 uninfected population
HSS I-Other 8 Confirmed malaria cases (microscopy or RDT): rate per 1000 persons per year
HSS I-Other 5 Estimated percentage of children newly infected with HIV from mother-to-child transmission among women living with HIV delivering in the past 12 months
HSS I-Other 4 Number of AIDS related deaths per 100,000 population
HSS I-Other 6 Reported malaria cases (presumed and confirmed)
HSS I-Other 1 TB incidence rate per 100,000 population
HSS I-Other 7 In-patient malaria deaths: rate per 100,000 persons per year
HSS I-Other 2 TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
Outcome indicator for MLI-S-MOH
HSS O-Other 4 Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART who are virologically suppressed

National aggregate HMIS fully deployed and functional: Percentage of HMIS components in place (HIS deployment, completeness, timeliness, and integration of aggregate disease reporting for HIV, TB and malaria indicators)

HSS O-Other 2 Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of all forms of TB cases (bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed) successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all forms of TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period

HSS O-Other 1 TB treatment coverage: Percentage of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)

HSS O-Other 3 Percentage of people living with HIV not on ART at the end of the reporting period among people living with HIV who were either on ART at the end of the last reporting period or newly initiated on ART during the reporting period
Coverage / Output indicator for MLI-S-MOH
Proportion of community health workers who received at least one supportive supervision during the reporting period
PSM-Other3 Percentage of health facilities with tracer medicines for malaria available during the reporting period
Percentage of facilities with functioning health committee (or similar) that includes community members and meets at least quarterly
SD-Other 1: Average number of home visits per Community Health Worker (CHW) per month
Percentage of service delivery reports from community health workers integrated into HMIS
Number of iCCM conditions treated among children under five in target areas during the reporting period
Timeliness of facility reporting: Percentage of submitted facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are received on time per the national guidelines
LAB-Other1 Percentage of laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance
PSM-Other2 Percentage of health facilities with tracer anti-TB medicines available during the reporting period
Percentage of facilities that receive supportive supervision – at least once per quarter
Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received
PSM-Other1 Percentage of health facilities with tracer ARV medicines available during the reporting period
